did.abstract: Member of Co. H, 339th U.S. Infantry who served in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes field diary recounting the Polar Bear expedition and photographs of Archangel and members of the expedition.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Edwrd Flaherty, of Detroit, Michigan, in 1964 (Donor no.: 4193).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Edward Flaherty papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

scopecontent.p: The collection contains a copy of the field diary of Co. H, Sept. 1918-Apr. 1919, describing the company's service on the Onega front, including fighting at Chekuevo, Sept. 1918; Wazentia[?], Oct. 1918; Turchasovo, Dec. 1918; Chinova, March 1919; and Bolshie Ozerki, March and April 1919. Also included are 34 photos by the American Red Cross, containing group portraits and pictures of base areas, churches, Russian people, soldiers on patrol, and fortifications, all taken in the Onega-Chekuevo area.
